alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 7:53PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Orange and northeastern Osceola Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 753 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Narcoossee, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wedgefield and Lake Hart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Florida.
